TopicTitle: Post something new you learn today!

Articles.Content:
We learn new things, hopefully everyday, and no matter how small or insignificant that is, it is still knowledge. Celebrate knowledge today and share with us what you learn!

Today I learned that a pressure bomb is not a bomb detonated by pressure. It is just a chamber to test the water potential of plants...

What about you? What did you learn today?

Edited August 23, 2015 by RainDreamer
I learned how to,disassemble and reassemble a french horn!
I learned that if you can climb a barbed wire fence you get free corn!
I learned about PID controllers!
I learned that ABBA is from Sweden and that I like ABBA.

I learned how to play an Aircraft Carrier! Useful stuff, let me tell you.

EDIT: This isn't something I learned today, but I did learn a while back how to actually speak biotronically.
I learned that some tv shows have absolutely no logic... i.e. when it takes the show 30 minutes to unravel something I can figure out in 1 minute or less.
...that you can tune a piano, but you can't tuna fish.
Today I learned that a vigorously shaken soda bottle has a max ISP of about 1.02s. Thanks K^2!
I learned that saw-whet Owls eat kinglets.
I learned how to mod minecraft because I wanted pretty shaders

Today, and thanks to Xyphos who mentioned the movie *Batteries not Included here, I solved an old personal mystery, and learnt that its french title "Miracle sur la 8ÃƒÂ¨me Rue" ("Miracle on 8th Street") is a reference to the 1947 Christmas movie Miracle on 34th Street. yay.

Today I learned the modes of actions of neurotoxic insecticides, just because I am curious of how they work, and because I am procrastinating doing my actual work...

Now I am surprised of the sophistication that went into the little cans of death that are sold widely to consumers. Technology becomes so much more exciting and interesting when you get to see and understand how they work.

I learned You should never Engage a Troll LOL

They are impervious to Sense and Reason.
I learned that Scatterer makes my KSP crash
I learned that I suck in Counter-Strike.

I learned that MarkLogic can't do an HTTP post with binary data and that it must be encoded as a string and wrapped in a json array as post data. This made me very angry because I couldn't simply zip up a set of XML transforms I had just processed but instead had to strip them and rewrap into a string format.
never fail a midterm if you are still living with your parents.

I learned that i can't never stop learning even sometime not to learn while i could also already knowing it before i learn it.

Edited October 13, 2015 by WinkAllKerb''
I learned that you guys learned something.
I hear that antelopes can jump higher than the average house due to their powerful hind legs... And the fact the average houses can't jump.

I learned...

..Yes.

I learned that there is no such thing as a vegetable, botanically. It's not a biological term, it's a purely culinary term for savory plant material. So the next time someone tells you a tomato is a fruit, not a vegetable, you can say that it's a fruit to a botanist, but a vegetable to a chef.
I learned how to become admin on any Microsoft computer (only because I locked myself out)

I learned you should never leave leftover spaghetti in a backpack for a month.

And if you do, don't sniff it.
